title: Staff Cloud Engineer
description: Job Description What is the Opportunity? Excited about cloud technologies? Looking to make a difference helping one of the biggest enterprises in Canada build and scale hybrid cloud? We need your help! At RBC, we build products on top of our cloud platforms to enable application teams to leverage platform capabilities and increase developer productivity. In this role, you will design and build scalable and resilient delivery and deployment systems on various cloud platforms that will enhance developer experience from onboarding to deployment to production. What will you do? • Design, develop, configure and maintain cloud-native application delivery solutions to address business requirements • Evaluate and troubleshoot system operations, providing solutions to optimize complex systems • Collaborate with a team of fellow engineers in building large scale solutions across public and private clouds • Create technical and product documentation for your solutions and the platform • Continuously learn new technical skills and practice by applying them in your day-to-day work • Support high profile customers to migrate their applications to RBC’s Kubernetes platforms Primary responsibilities: Design and implement highly available, scalable, and resilient systems and components for a cloud native technology stack • Develops detailed plans and accurate estimates for the design, build, implementation and stabilization of features and systems • Manages all aspects of testing and verification ensuring all tasks are completed Actively participates in defining, planning and executing team activities, such as providing recommendations for engineering and process improvements • Recommends strategies to enhance developer experience, platform engineering and operations, and team planning activities • Collaborates with teammates and peers to plan, build and maintain high quality technical solutions Responsible for configuration, maintenance, release and troubleshooting Kubernetes workload delivery technology and tools. • Manages CI/CD for platform components and continuous delivery system for applications • Ensures cloud system applications meet high quality standards • Manages day-to-day administration activities, including but not limited to performance tuning/scaling Support and provide guidance to high profile application teams to migrate applications to the cloud in face-paced environment. • Provides guidance on transforming into cloud native application using platform tools. Must-have • Experience developing software, with proficiency in high level programming languages, ideally Go • Experience with RESTful APIs • Experience with containerization technologies like Docker • Experience with Kubernetes • Knowledge of CI/CD and DevOps best practices • Effective communication skills and a learning attitude Nice-to-have • Experience with industry standard CI/CD tooling and cloud native technologies • Experience creating and manipulating YAML files • Experience working with Azure, AWS cloud and/or Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform • Experience working in an Agile development environment What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team • A world-class training program in financial services • Flexible work/life balance options • Opportunities to do challenging work • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients #LI-POST #TECHPJ Job Skills Agile Scrum Development, Cloud Computing Architecture, Cloud Platform, Cloud Technology, Computer Programming, Computer Software, Containerization, Continuous Delivery, Design, DevOps, Go Programming Language, Infrastructure As Code (IaC), Kubernetes, Systems Software, Teamwork Additional Job Details Address: 330 FRONT ST W:TORONTO City: Toronto Country: Canada Work hours/week: 37.5 Employment Type: Full time Platform: TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS Job Type: Regular Pay Type: Salaried Posted Date: 2025-07-22 Application Deadline: 2026-01-12 Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

title: Cloud Engineer - Enterprise AI Services/Big Data
description: Overview: We are seeking a driven and talented Cloud Engineer to join our growing Enterprise AI Services team in Platform Engineering. As a Cloud Engineer, Enterprise AI Services/Big Data reporting to our Enterprise AI Services Senior Manager, you will be instrumental in designing, building, and maintaining the cloud infrastructure that powers our cutting-edge AI solutions for enterprise clients. This is an opportunity to work with leading-edge technologies in a fast-paced and collaborative environment. About the Role: • Leverage your strong C# programming skills to design, develop, and implement highly scalable, resilient, and secure Enterprise AI Services. This includes building foundational components for Agentic AI, LLM orchestration, and intelligent automation. • Work closely with Enterprise AI Services and Big Data technical teams and architects to establish and deliver Cloud/SaaS based technologies and services including Azure Open AI, AWS Bedrock, Azure API Management, Google Cloud APIGEE, Snowflake, Power BI and other emerging technologies to Thomson Reuters product teams. • Partner with product development teams to implement best practices and optimize performance of the Enterprise AI and Cloud applications • Participate in the analysis of new SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS services, then develop automation and solutions to support using them at enterprise scale • Manage cloud service product/feature upgrades, including testing and release planning • Research new AI and Cloud technologies and assess maturity and alignment of the technology to business and technology strategy. Collaborate with vendors on previewing technologies. • Evaluate and incorporate enterprise-grade security features as standard components of the service offerings we produce, in alignment with Thomson Reuters information security team • Prepare and present high quality technical and non-technical documentation • Communicate in a professional manner when interacting across staff levels and internal customers • Evaluate and communicate risk as a top consideration for all solutions and changes being made on behalf customers About You: You’re a fit for the role of Cloud Engineer, Enterprise AI Services/Big Data, if you have • B.S./B.A. Computer Science or related field; or equivalent level of experience • C# Programming Language required. • Demonstrated use of Python and/or SQL is an asset • Previous Software or Cloud engineering and development experience required • Snowflake experience heavily preferred, including Stored Procedures and administrative functions. • AWS Cloud experience (highly recommended, Cloud Practitioner and higher AWS certification preferred) • Azure Cloud experience (highly recommended, AZ-900 or AI-900 and higher Azure certification preferred) • Google Cloud experience (APIGEE preferred) • Understanding of cloud infrastructure. Understanding of non-relational database and search technologies. Understanding of vector capabilities and other AI functions. • Demonstrated use of CI/CD technologies is a plus, • Understanding of tools like Azure DevOps, GitHub, GitHub Actions, JFrog Artifactory, Docker preferred. • Strong passion for technology and a willingness to learn new skills and use new technologies like AI coding assistants like GitHub Co-Pilot or Claude Code. • Self-motivation and self-direction, ability to translate technical direction and apply to specific work responsibilities • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams across global time zones. • Ability to investigate complex issues spanning multiple technologies • Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills #LI-MW1 What’s in it For You? • Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected. • Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance. • Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future. • Industry Competitive Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing. • Culture: Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together. • Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives. • Making a Real-World Impact: We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world. About Us Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news. We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward. As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace. We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here. Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here. title: Lead Cloud Engineer - Kubernetes & OpenShift Infra
description: A leading Canadian bank is seeking a Cloud Engineer to join their Cloud Engineering and Transformation team in Toronto. This role focuses on the design, implementation, and management of containerized applications using platforms like Kubernetes and OpenShift. The ideal candidate has strong DevOps experience and a passion for innovative cloud solutions. CIBC offers a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive environment to grow your career. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description: Application Deadline: 12/30/2025 Address: 33 Dundas Street West Job Family Group: Technology We are seeking an enthusiastic, passionate professional for a Cloud Engineering position with extensive experience with AWS cloud services. BMO’s cloud strategy is focused on innovation, leveraging rapidly emerging cloud native services to meet the rapidly evolving needs of our customers. The BMO Cloud Engineering team is leading the way at a Bank where our Purpose is Growing The Good and Being Bold. We demonstrate those values every day. Be part of the action – where we have challenging discussions about how to align those customer requirements to the right cloud architectures and services. Help evolve the BMO’s core cloud platform, leveraging emerging best practices and tools, securely connected to our strategic suppliers, providing a platform for innovation to an entire Bank. Responsibilities: Working in a close-knit technical team, the role will: • Design and implement BMO Cloud Platform, core and shared services • Drive holistic design & patterns for secure cloud application environments, Cloud platform enhancements, data services, and cloud service integrations • Partner with other stakeholders to drive the creation of Cloud migration & transformation strategy and infrastructure roadmaps across application, information, business and technology landscapes • Develop patterns for automated provisioning, management, scalability and security • Ensure that all cloud solutions follow internally defined security and compliance standards and controls • Design and plan enterprise-scale cloud environments including application dependencies, data storage and flow, network connectivity and overall cloud hosting • Design, implement and secure cloud IaaS, PaaS and higher services in AWS • Develop and maintain up-to-date architectural templates, build and operational documentation of the technical environment • Work in close collaboration with the rest of Engineering, DevOps and CIO teams to develop Service Catalogues • Continuously enhance the capability, security and experience of the enterprise cloud Required Core Skills: • Understanding of cloud design patterns, Cloud Native principles, cloud operations and cloud security models • Strong programming skills and fluency with at least one of the following scripting languages: Python, Bash, PowerShell • Strong Knowledge and proven experience in setting up, securing and managing public cloud infrastructure • Demonstrated knowledge of cloud provisioning and administration, cloud interoperability, cloud disaster recovery and business continuity strategies, as well as performance measurement and monitoring in the cloud • Proficiency in cloud automation using AWS CLI, Azure CLI, CDK, CloudFormation, ARM or terraform. • Hands-on experience with system configuration and DevOps tools preferably Ansible, Bitbucket, Git, Jira and Confluence • Experience and knowledge of running containers and containers infrastructure in the cloud on a large scale • Experience working on Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), AWS Fargate, Elastic Container Service (ECS) • Experience working on Lambda, API Gateway, Kinesis Data Stream, SNS, SQS, DynamoDB • Ability to participate in and keep up with fast-paced DevOps and System Engineering teams within Agile processes • Experience with AI concepts, GenAI, prompt engineering, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), AI-powered tools in SDLC etc Other Skills: • Strong interpersonal and communication Skills • A critical thinker with strong research and analytics skills • Self-motivated with a positive attitude and an ability to work independently and/or in a team • Able to work under tight timelines and deliver on complex problems Salary: $75,900.00 - $141,900.00 Pay Type: Salaried The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type. Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position. BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards About Us At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en. BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Azure Cloud Engineer
description: Your new company Join a mission-driven organization dedicated to delivering innovative technology solutions that support impactful initiatives. You’ll be part of a collaborative team focused on leveraging cloud technologies to drive efficiency and scalability. Your new role As an Azure Solutions Developer, you will design and build secure, performant, and scalable serverless data applications in the Azure cloud. You’ll architect solutions using Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and modern integration patterns, ensuring compliance with security and regulatory standards. Key responsibilities include: • Architect and implement serverless applications using Azure Functions and Logic Apps. • Design secure authentication and authorization flows with Microsoft Entra ID (OAuth 2.0). • Develop RESTful APIs for integration and data exchange. • Configure real-time data synchronization between multiple Salesforce instances. • Implement monitoring, logging, and performance optimization for serverless workflows. • Apply best practices for secure API development and OAuth token management. What you'll need to succeed • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. • 5+ years of experience in application development and integration using Azure services. • Proven expertise in serverless architectures, OAuth-based authentication, and REST API development. • Hands-on experience with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and event-driven data pipelines. • Proficiency in Microsoft Entra ID (OAuth 2.0) for secure authentication. Experience integrating Salesforce using APIs and real-time sync mechanisms. • Familiarity with Azure monitoring tools, cloud security best practices, and DevOps deployment automation. What you'll get in return • Opportunity to work on impactful projects leveraging cutting-edge Azure technologies. • A collaborative and inclusive work environment. • Competitive compensation and benefits package. What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. This posting is not for an existing vacancy with the organization. AI may be used to screen, assess or select applicants for the position. #LI-DNI #1122498 - Blake Robinson

title: Developer, Cloud Engineering
description: Requisition ID: 233513 Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture. Scotiabank has embarked on the journey to modernize both development practices and tools. One of the main areas of transformation is the public cloud and the various platform technologies that support both development and operations on the cloud. The aim is to provide a streamlined process and framework which will allow the development teams to focus on building business logic. We are looking to build our development team with influencers, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward. The role of the Cloud Engineer operates within the Cloud Database Engineering team. This valuable member of the team will be responsible for creating platform components and services for the broad enterprise use. Is this role right for you? In this role you will: • Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge. • Key accountabilities include development and maintenance of cloud platforms, services, and components to enable safe enterprise-wide use of public cloud offerings. • Knowledge of a component of a larger product. • Assisting in implementing, and refactoring code. • Assisting in ensuring software, programs and applications are developed and/or configured to meet high availability, integrity and reliability, security, and compliance requirements. • Working with other engineers and architects on breaking-down, scoping and estimating tasks. • Working with application teams for successful onboarding onto the Platform. • Participating in planning and retrospective sessions, attending stand-ups and on call rotations etc. • Be able to build and operate the highly available and scalable software and infrastructure. Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have: Must Have: • 3+ years of experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) • 5+ years of experience with database technologies (Cloud SQL – MySQL/PostgreSQL/SQL Server, Alloy DB, MongoDB and related GCP/Azure Database Technologies) • 3+ years of experience with Terraform • 3+ years of experience with GitHub, GitHub Actions. • 3+ years of experience with development languages (Go, Java, Python, etc) • 3+ years of experience with container-based technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) • 3+ years of experience in the use of CI/CD Tools • At least 3+ years of experience with config management tools and Scripting Languages (Ansible, Bash, Groovy) • Good oral and written communication skills Nice to Have: • Experience with Microsoft Azure. • Experience with Redis. • Bachelor (equivalent or higher) degree in computer science or engineering/mathematics discipline. • Understanding of Cloud Native Platforms, particularly Kubernetes, and associated technologies (e.g., Istio, Envoy, Anthos, Kustomize). • Experience working with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, etc. • Understanding of software development lifecycle and release process (container-native workflow for job orchestration, Git/GitOps, CI/CD, environments, code repositories). • Understanding of different database technologies (e.g. CloudSQL, NoSQL, Relational databases) • Focus on scalable, enterprise-level software system design (both on code and infrastructure levels) • Passion for driving teams towards high performance and a deep pride in quality craftsmanship. • Unix administration skills. What's in it for you? • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans. • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements. • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance. • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one. Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, Humans of Digital and much more! #ScotiaCloud Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Cloud Engineer, Global Treasury Tech Job Details | Scotiabank
description: Requisition ID: 238240 Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward: $0.00 We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank. The Team The Global Risk and Treasury Technology team provides development and support services for Group Treasury (including Structural Interest Rate Risk management, Asset/Liability Management, Funds Transfer Pricing, Liquidity Risk, Stress Testing) and Global Risk Management (Global Retail/Corporate/Commercial Credit Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk, Operational/Non-Operational Risk Management). The Role • We are looking for a Data Engineer with a foundational understanding of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and a strong interest in financial data domains. This role will support the development and maintenance of data pipelines and contribute to data integration efforts across finance and treasury systems. The ideal candidate is eager to learn, detail-oriented, and passionate about working in a data-driven financial environment. Is this role right for you? In this role you will: • Assist in building and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines using Azure Data Factory, SQL Server, and BigQuery. • Support data integration and transformation tasks across Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake, and GCP BigQuery. • Collaborate with senior engineers and analysts to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions. • Help monitor and troubleshoot data workflows to ensure accuracy and reliability. • Participate in data quality checks, documentation, and version control practices. • Contribute to projects involving financial data such as cash flow, liquidity, general ledger, and regulatory reporting. Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have • 3+ years of experience in data engineering, data analytics, or a related field (internships or co-op experience welcome). • Basic proficiency in SQL and familiarity with SQL Server or Azure SQL Database. • Exposure to Azure Data Factory, BigQuery, or other cloud-based data tools. • Understanding of data concepts such as ETL, data modeling, and data warehousing. • Interest or academic background in finance, accounting, or treasury operations. • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. • Willingness to learn and grow in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Preferred Qualifications: • Experience with SSIS, Databricks, or Python for data processing. • Familiarity with financial systems or reporting tools. • Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure or GCP) through coursework or certifications. • Exposure to Agile/Scrum methodologies. The Workplace • We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work • We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success! • You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world • We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning • We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results • We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation #ScotiaCloud Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted. title: AWS Infrastructure Engineer with CDK Expertise
description: Role: AWS Infrastructure Engineer with CDK Expertise Location: Toronto Hybrid 1yr contract (Extension) As an **AWS Infrastructure Engineer**, you will be responsible for designing, deploying, and managing scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure using **AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)**. You will collaborate with development teams to implement infrastructure as code (IaC) practices, ensuring consistency, efficiency, and scalability in our cloud environments. Key Responsibilities • Design and implement highly available and scalable AWS infrastructure using **AWS CDK** in collaboration with development and DevOps teams. • Develop and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using **AWS CDK (Typescript, Python, Java)** to automate provisioning of AWS resources such as EC2, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, VPC, IAM, RDS, etc. • Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines for automated deployment and integration using AWS services like CodePipeline, CodeBuild, and third-party tools. • Create and maintain **CloudFormation stacks** and other IaC templates to automate and streamline the infrastructure management process. • Develop reusable infrastructure modules and templates for rapid deployment and improved standardization across the organization. • Provide guidance and expertise to development teams to adopt best practices in deploying and managing cloud infrastructure. • Perform infrastructure performance monitoring and troubleshooting to ensure high availability, security, and scalability. • Ensure compliance with security and governance policies while maintaining a cost-effective cloud architecture. • Stay up-to-date with new AWS features, services, and best practices, and integrate relevant technologies into our existing cloud environment. • Troubleshoot and resolve cloud infrastructure issues, providing on-call support as needed. Required Skills & Qualifications • Strong experience with **AWS services** (EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, IAM, CloudFormation, VPC, etc.). • Proven expertise in **AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)** with hands-on experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure-as-code. • Experience with programming languages such as **TypeScript, Python, Java, or similar** for CDK development. • Deep understanding of **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** and automation tools. • Experience designing and deploying highly available, secure, and scalable cloud architectures on AWS. • Familiarity with **CI/CD** pipelines and tools such as **AWS CodePipeline**, **CodeBuild**, and Jenkins. • Strong understanding of **security best practices** in the cloud (IAM, KMS, VPC security, etc.). • Experience with **monitoring** and **logging** in AWS (CloudWatch, CloudTrail, X-Ray, etc.). • Familiarity with **serverless architectures** using AWS Lambda and related services. • Experience working in an agile, DevOps-oriented environment. • Ability to communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Preferred Skills • AWS Certification, such as **AWS Certified Solutions Architect** or **AWS Certified DevOps Engineer**. • Experience with other **Infrastructure as Code** tools like Terraform. • Understanding of **Kubernetes** and **ECS/EKS**. • Familiarity with **Docker** and containerization strategies. • Experience with **monitoring** and **logging** platforms such as **Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog**, etc. • Knowledge of **serverless computing** and **AWS SAM**

title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
description: Senior Infrastructure Engineer At Chexy, we're reimagining how Canadians manage their largest expenses—like rent, tuition, and insurance—by transforming them into opportunities to earn rewards, build credit, and gain financial flexibility. We're the first platform in Canada that lets users pay nearly any bill using their credit card, while unlocking meaningful benefits like cashback, points, and credit-building tools. With $1B+ in annual payment volume and millions of transactions per month, we're not just building software—we're building the infrastructure that moves real money for real people. About the Role We're looking for a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to lead our infrastructure scaling efforts as we prepare for significant growth in transaction volume. You'll own critical infrastructure decisions and strengthen our security posture as we grow from processing $1B to $10B+ and beyond. This role involves designing and implementing the infrastructure foundation for Canada's next generation of financial services—systems that are compliant, secure, scalable, and built to handle high-stakes financial transactions. What You'll Be Doing • Design and implement infrastructure to support rapid growth in transaction volume while maintaining high reliability and performance • Architect and maintain PCI DSS 4.0 and SOC 2 Type II compliant infrastructure across all production systems • Own and optimize our Google Cloud Platform infrastructure including Cloud Run, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, Cloud Deploy, BigQuery, and KMS • Manage and evolve our Terraform codebase for infrastructure provisioning and configuration management • Build and maintain observability systems using Datadog for application performance monitoring, infrastructure monitoring, and alerting • Lead security initiatives including encryption strategies, secret management, network security, audit trails, and compliance automation • Optimize infrastructure for performance, reliability, and cost efficiency at scale • Collaborate with backend engineers to deploy, monitor, and optimize the handling of Chexy's payment processing systems • Establish infrastructure best practices and mentor engineers on DevOps and cloud architecture Who We're Looking For • 5+ years of infrastructure/platform/DevOps engineering experience, with at least 3+ years of hands-on Google Cloud Platform experience • Deep expertise with GCP services including Cloud Run, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, Cloud Deploy, KMS, and GCP networking • Strong experience with Terraform for infrastructure provisioning and configuration management • Proven experience with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, CircleCI), containerization (Docker), and deployment automation • Experience with production observability tools like Datadog for APM, infrastructure monitoring, log aggregation, and alerting • Strong understanding of security practices including encryption, secrets management, IAM, network security, and compliance frameworks • Track record of building and maintaining high-volume, high-availability systems with strict SLAs • Experience with incident response, troubleshooting production issues, and writing clear postmortems • Ability to communicate technical decisions effectively to both engineering teams and leadership • Self-directed with strong ownership mentality and attention to reliability, security, and performance Bonus Points • Experience with financial systems, payment processing, or fintech infrastructure • PostgreSQL performance tuning and scaling (we use Cloud SQL + Prisma) • Redis optimization and caching strategies • Direct experience with PCI DSS or SOC 2 compliance initiatives • Contributions to open-source infrastructure projects • Experience with Vanta or similar compliance automation tools • Cloudflare configuration and optimization • NestJS or TypeScript microservices architecture Why Join Chexy? 💥 Build infrastructure that moves billions: Your work directly enables millions of dollars in rent payments and life-changing financial transactions for Canadians 💬 Join a tight-knit team: Work directly with founders and senior engineers who trust you to make critical decisions 📈 Early equity: Access equity in a high-growth fintech company that's just getting started 🛠 Own real impact: No bureaucracy, no endless meetings—just smart people solving hard problems together 📍 Toronto office: Work in-office 5 days a week with the team in Toronto How We Hire We keep our hiring process clear and human. You'll go through a mix of conversational interviews and technical deep-dives designed to showcase your strengths. We care about how you think, how you've solved real infrastructure problems, and how you collaborate—not just trivia questions. And we make sure there's space for your questions too. Chexy is an equal opportunity employer. If you require any accommodations or support during the hiring process, let us know and we'll do our best to help.

title: Azure Infrastructure Engineer
description: Key Responsibilities • Develop, maintain, and optimize Infrastructure-as-Code solutions using CDKTF and Terraform for Azure services. • Build reusable CDKTF modules and constructs for enterprise data and AI patterns. • Implement automated CI/CD workflows for infrastructure deployments using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions. • Provision and configure Azure AI services including Azure OpenAI, Cognitive Services (Vision, Speech, Language, Decision), Azure Machine Learning Workspace, MLOps pipelines, and Document Intelligence. • Design and manage Azure data services including Cosmos DB (SQL & Mongo APIs), Azure Data Factory (pipelines & data flows), Azure SQL Managed Instance, and Synapse Analytics. • Configure Azure networking and security components such as VNets, Key Vault, App Services, Storage, and application security configurations. • Implement MLOps practices for model deployment, monitoring, versioning, and automation. • Ensure compliance, performance, and reliability of AI and data workloads. • Collaborate with architects, data engineers, and AI teams to deliver cloud-native solutions.

title: Senior Business Infrastructure Engineer
description: About the CanCap CanCap Group delivers fully managed programs for third-party financial institutions. We are seeking a Senior Business Infrastructure Lead—a unique role blending technical leadership and management with hands-on execution to manage our core business infrastructure and support a growing team. You will lead a small, high-impact team at the nexus of Tier-3 escalations, emergency response, networking, device management, cloud, and business automation. This is a critical leadership role where you will be relied upon to solve the most complex technical problems while driving the team's strategy and development. Key Responsibilities • Manage the team responsible for key enterprise deliverables, including business system design and implementation, system redundancy and automation, and next generation solutions. • Provide leadership and be actively engaged in the diagnosis, triage and resolution of complex issues across the environment (windows server, cloud identity, network, devices), providing emergency response and incident management for critical infrastructure failures, network outages, etc. • Lead networking/routing/switching activities: design, configure, monitor and troubleshoot LAN/WAN, IPSec/VPN tunnels, routing, firewall issues. • Manage device and endpoint infrastructure: device provisioning (using Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, RMMs), patching, configuration management, imaging, endpoint security, enterprise access controls. • Manage cloud infrastructure: particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and hybrid/cloud identity models; ensure configuration, security, monitoring, cost-control. • Develop and maintain business automation solutions: using Microsoft Power Apps, flows, scripts, integration with line-of-business applications. • Drive continual improvement: automate repetitive tasks, streamline infrastructure processes, reduce “lights-on” effort, improve reliability and availability. • Maintain documentation, runbooks, and knowledge base for escalation, outages, configuration, changes. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (help desk, application owners, security, network, operations) to support business goals and infrastructure initiatives. • Stay current on evolving technologies, evaluate and recommend infrastructure improvements and best practices. Required Skills & Experience • 5+ years of hands‐on experience in an infrastructure engineering or senior systems/network/endpoint role (or equivalent) • 2+ years of team management experience. • Project level enterprise budgeting, Vendor and Cost Management. • Strong fundamentals in at least 3 of: Routing, switching, LAN/WAN, VPN, Firewalls/Security, IPSec, PKI, Virtualization. • Deep expertise in Windows environments: such as Active Directory (on-premises & hybrid), Windows Server, GPOs, domain trusts, identity management, Intune, PowerAutomate. • Cloud infrastructure experience, specifically with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is highly preferred; hybrid cloud environments a plus. • Help-desk escalation experience: comfortable stepping into high-pressure incident response, diagnosing complex issues, communicating with endpoints, business users and technical teams. • Ability to document, mentor, and build runbooks, knowledgebase content, and standard operating procedures. • Strong communication and collaboration skills: able to interface with IT teams, business stakeholders, and vendors. Preferred Skills & Certifications • Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP (networking); MS SC Certified Modern Desktop/Enterprise Administrator; Azure/AWS/GCP cloud certifications; PKI/PKCS certifications. • Experience with hybrid identity (Azure AD + on-premises AD, or similar). • Experience managing a Telephony solution. • Familiarity with automation/orchestration frameworks (Terraform, Ansible) and infrastructure-as-code concepts. • Experience with monitoring, logging, and observability tools. • Exposure to IT Service Management (ITSM) and incident/change management frameworks. What You’ll Bring to the Team • Technical Ownership & Accountability: You take full ownership of critical incidents and projects, driving them from inception to a stable, well-documented resolution. • Proactive & Automation-Minded: You anticipate problems before they become outages, viewing manual, repeatable tasks as opportunities for automation. • Business Alignment: You understand that technical decisions must support business outcomes and use this view to prioritize infrastructure strategy. • A Collaborative Leader: You are keen to lead by example, mentor the team, and work seamlessly with cross-functional partners. You will lead a growing team to enhance enterprise collaboration and automation in a dynamic environment. Why Join Us • Opportunity to have broad exposure (network, identity, cloud, endpoint, automation) and make measurable impact. • Hands-on role with both day-to-day support and longer-term infrastructure evolution. • Be part of a team that values automation, documentation, reliability and innovation. • Great culture of learning, growth and cross-discipline collaboration This role is a hybrid work structure, with 50% of your time spent in office and 50% working from home. This could change based on the needs of the business. To be considered for employment you will need to successfully pass a criminal background check and validate your work experience. Next Steps Adding to our team is one of the important steps that happens in our business. We’ve taken time to be purposeful and thoughtful with this job posting. Please take time to do the same with your application. Help us understand how you see your work experience as relatable to this job posting. Help us understand how you would be a great addition to our team. Diversity and Inclusion The CanCap Group and our subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and value diversity. We are committed to building and evolving a team reflecting a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Candidates who possess the experience, skills, and qualifications outlined above will be contacted for next steps in the hiring process.

title: Infrastructure & Capital Project - Electrical Engineer, COM
description: You’ve Never Been Satisfied with “Good Enough.” You want to make an impact, not just manage projects, but change how the world gets built. At Accenture Infrastructure & Capital Projects, you’ll do exactly that. You’ll help develop and deliver the factories, grids, transit systems, and public infrastructure that keep communities moving - and do it smarter, safer, and more sustainably than ever before. You’ll work alongside people who think big and act bold - project managers, engineers, technologists, and strategists who blend real-world experience with digital innovation and AI. Together, we’re transforming how capital projects are planned, managed, and executed, creating a better way to build for the future. Because “good enough” builds the past. You’re here to build what’s next, on a team that outperforms every norm. Visit us here to learn more about Accenture Infrastructure & Capital Projects • (Internal Title: Engineering VI) • Review and critically evaluate feasibility study deliverables relating to power supply, substation design, mine and plant power distribution, and electrical infrastructure • Provide Owner’s perspective and guidance on power supply options, interconnection studies, power balance, and electrical loads • Liaise with the local utility provider in Arizona to track and influence interconnection agreements, timelines, and permitting. • Support procurement strategies relating to electrical equipment and systems (transformers, switchgear, substations, overhead and underground distribution, etc.) • Act as the primary electrical engineering interface between the Owner and the EPC/M contractor • Review design packages and engineering deliverables prepared by the EPC/M to ensure compliance with project requirements, codes, and industry standards (NEC, IEEE, CSA, NESC, NFPA, as applicable)Provide independent technical review on electrical designs including substations, motor control centers, drives, power distribution, grounding, lighting, and control systems • Identify risks, gaps, or opportunities for value engineering and report findings to the Project Director • Monitor construction methodologies, quality control processes, and electrical installation works carried out by contractors • Participate in factory acceptance testing (FAT) and site acceptance testing (SAT) for major electrical equipment • Support commissioning planning and execution, ensuring electrical systems are fully tested, reliable, and safe for operation • Verify that electrical systems integrate effectively with plant control systems and meet project performance and reliability requirements • Provide troubleshooting expertise during ramp-up to resolve electrical reliability or performance issues • Document lessons learned for future projects and provide operational handover to owner’s operations and maintenance teams • Engage in the practice of professional engineering which: • Requires the application of engineering principles • Is an act of planning, designing, composing, evaluating, advising, reporting, supervising, or managing any of these acts • Involves the safeguarding of life, health, property, economic interests, the public welfare or the environment • Comply with regulations and guidelines for the practice of professional engineering in the State or Province of licensure including but not limited to professional responsibility, the Engineer’s duty to report, , due diligence, report writing, giving opinions, communications, confidential information, data gathering, and site investigations • Apply expert-level engineering knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to meet project requirements in the area of expertise • Implement and direct the specialty engineering services on the project from inception through to completion • Advise on the daily work and control the delivery of the project portfolio per project plans • Ensure goals are met including customer satisfaction, and engineering team member performance • Oversee the interface between client, consultants, and all associated service providers at all levels of the engagement model • Direct the implementation and management of changes and interventions to ensure engineering service goals are achieved on the project or program • Facilitate project focus and functional meetings for engineering initiatives • Manage senior-level customer relationships • Ensure there is a communication plan in place for meeting with stakeholders (including senior management and sponsors) to make the exchange of project-related information easy and transparent • Identify and analyze risks and implement mitigation strategies and contingency plans • Review and ensure adherence to the engineering services delivery plan, scope, schedule, milestones, budgets, and KPIs and address issues with corrective actions as appropriate • Control the delivery of functional engineering progress reports, proposals, and presentations to various audiences including the project team, senior executives, key stakeholders, and Comtech Operations • Evaluate and ensure the accurate interpretation of the functional scope of the assignment and manage and support any scope change negotiations • Set and adjust, if required, the functional engineering services expectations for the project or program while delegating and managing deliverables with the functional engineering team • Build and maintain a positive, high-performing team culture with an openness to constructive challenge, continuous improvement, implementation of lessons learned, and an overall ‘right-first-time” mindset • Nurture a project environment that is inclusive, and diverse and celebrates our differences • Clarify and resolve internal quality control checks and issues for the project • Working Conditions • Hybrid - The work location for this role will include a mix of working remotely, onsite at a client or in an Accenture office or center.

title: Engineering Manager, Infrastructure
description: We are looking for an Engineering Manager - Infrastructure to join our Platform Infrastructure Group. Reporting to the Director of Engineering - Infrastructure, you will work closely with key technical partners across the organization to ensure that BenchSci’s development tooling, cloud infrastructure, and engineering practices can support our long-term growth, you will provide technical leadership across several areas within the team, lead complex projects, participate in roadmap and project planning, and actively contribute to BenchSci's technical roadmap. You Will: • Identify parts of our system and codebases that do not scale or meet reliability, performance, observability, and security requirements • Work with the infrastructure team to drive high-quality designs to improve and scale our infrastructure provisioning and CI/CD pipelines • Collaborate closely with the security and GRC teams to ensure that our cloud configuration has adequate security controls, and meets contractual and compliance requirements • Develop and exercise disaster recovery plans and improve those capabilities. • Partner with various engineering teams and identify opportunities to improve our development tooling, frameworks, and infrastructure • Partner closely with other Staff Engineers, Engineering Managers, and Directors to devise and refine requirements to create development tooling, and build systems and services that accelerate the velocity of our engineers • Lead software and system design initiatives by leveraging cloud-native design patterns and injecting your cloud expertise into the entire development lifecycle You Have: • 4-5 years of experience in a similar role in a SaaS or similar industry • In-depth experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP) • Experience developing, maintaining, and scaling CI/CD pipelines • Experience developing, maintaining, and scaling build tools for supporting large monorepo codebases and service-oriented architectures. • Working knowledge of infrastructure-as-code solutions such as Terraform or KCC • A deep understanding of containerization, and extensive experience with Docker and Kubernetes • Expert knowledge of observability tools and techniques in a cloud-native environment • Experience working with Python, Javascript, or similar programming languages. • Experience as a People Manager is a mustBenefits and Perks: • A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options • A robust vacation policy plus an additional vacation day every year • Company closures for 14 more days throughout the year • Flex time for sick days, personal days, and religious holidays • Comprehensive health and dental benefits • Annual learning & development budget • A one-time home office set-up budget to use upon joining BenchSci • An annual lifestyle spending account allowance • Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options • The ability to save for your retirement coupled with a company match! About BenchSci: BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform. Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at top pharmaceutical companies and leading academic centers. Our Culture: Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning. We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement. You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives. Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

title: Senior Infrastructure Resiliency Engineer
description: Job Description What is the Opportunity? The Disaster Recovery and BCM team within the Data Centres and Operational Resiliency department is responsible to support RBC’s critical business processes by ensuring technology is prepared to recover from the unexpected. As a Senior Infrastructure Resiliency Engineer you will be responsible for assessing disaster readiness and overall application resiliency based on critical risks. You will refine guidelines for resiliency and disaster readiness, review DR plans and recommend architecture improvements to mitigate risk and remove single points of failure. You will be part of an important program of continuous improvement that ensures the ongoing resilience of RBC as we become a digitally enabled relationship bank. What will you do? • Assess critical business processes from an end-to-end viewpoint in order to identify Resiliency risks and recommend technology and process changes. • Align DR Guidelines with Global Risk Standards and participate in Change Management to ensure compliance. • Partner with the Infrastructure Architecture and Platform teams to continually update design patterns to ensure the use of the latest technological advancements. • Participate with the Disaster Recovery team on exercises and contribute recommendations on continuous improvement. • Partner with the ITSM team to monitor Incident and Problem tickets and participate in root cause analysis to specify Resiliency or DR factors. • Research and remain current on multiple technology platforms. What do you need to succeed? Must-have • Senior operational experience (on-call break-fix) with either Windows or Linux, and a functional understanding of both. • Good experience with resiliency design including clusters, high availability and failover. • Good experience with Disaster Recovery including design, exercise planning and execution. • Good understanding of IT infrastructure including virtualization, databases, SAN and NAS storage, messaging, networking and Cloud. Nice to have: • Scripting and automation using Ansible or similar tools. • Experience with ServiceNow. • Familiarity with multi-tier application design. What’s in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable. • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities. • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact. • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team. • A world-class training program in financial services. • Opportunities to do challenging work. #LI-POST #TECHPJ Job Skills Adaptability, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Detail-Oriented, Industry Knowledge, Information Technology (IT) Systems Support, Information Technology Operations, Information Technology Trends, IT Disaster Recovery, IT Infrastructure Architecture, Risk Management, Technology Platforms, Time Management Additional Job Details Address: RBC CENTRE, 155 WELLINGTON ST W:TORONTO City: Toronto Country: Canada Work hours/week: 37.5 Employment Type: Full time Platform: TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS Job Type: Regular Pay Type: Salaried Posted Date: 2025-10-15 Application Deadline: 2025-11-28 Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all. Join our Talent Community Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you. Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

Coordinate testing planning, support with partners (e.g. business, CIO group, Infrastructure).Lead documentation creation, review, sign-off (e.g. test strategies, plans, schedule, cost estimates, test cases, dashboards, defect logs, test phase closure reports, entry/exit criteria and gating). title: Sr DevOps Engineer - Java
description: Java Devops Engineer Toronto - Remote Exp level - 5+ years "Job Specific / Technical Competencies: Administering Unix VM Hosts • Expertise on the Linux/ Unix (AIX) environments. • Expertise on scripting with bash/shell. • Good analytical & Problem-Solving skills • Good understanding of Application environment (Troubleshooting issues related to applications hosted on Linux boxes) • Experience in handling Java exceptions, Oracle DB errors and similar application failures. • Expertise in deploying builds using Software Configuration Management tools, bootstrapped deployments, Jenkins, CHEF and Bitbucket and release management activities. • Alert handling and monitoring using tools like Splunk and perform triaging of incidents. • Good understanding of networking concepts such as Firewall/VPN. Must be able to trace network / connectivity issues that impacts application. • Have performed server-side Automation – shell scripting, ansible or similar tools. • Have experience working on ITSM tools – BMC Remedy Helix, Jira • Experienced in setting up and administering middleware tools – IBM MQ, Kafka and Tibco FTL • Security and Quality Orientation, SSL certificate management. • Google Cloud will be a plus. • Good communication • Experience in Application (Envt) support (ability to triage applications hosted on Unix servers.) Expected Technical skills: • OS: Unix (AIX) / Windows, • Scripting and DevOps: PowerShell, Bash/Shell, Jenkins, CHEF, Ansible and Bitbucket, Chocolatey packages and Venafi • Middleware: IBM MQ, Kafka and Tibco FTL • Networking: concepts of Firewall/VPN • Monitoring tool: Splunk, UC4 • ITSM tools – BMC Remedy Helix, Jira • Internet / Web Technologies: Apache, Nginx, JBoss, Tomcat, Microsoft IIS 4-7, Typo3 (Good to have) "

title: Azure DevOps Engineer, Deloitte Global Technology
description: Job Type: Permanent Work Model: Remote Reference code: 130986 Primary Location: Toronto, ON All Available Locations: Toronto, ON Our Purpose At Deloitte, our Purpose is to make an impact that matters. We exist to inspire and help our people, organizations, communities, and countries to thrive by building a better future. Our work underpins a prosperous society where people can find meaning and opportunity. It builds consumer and business confidence, empowers organizations to find imaginative ways of deploying capital, enables fair, trusted, and functioning social and economic institutions, and allows our friends, families, and communities to enjoy the quality of life that comes with a sustainable future. And as the largest 100% Canadian-owned and operated professional services firm in our country, we are proud to work alongside our clients to make a positive impact for all Canadians. By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters. • Have many careers in one Firm. • Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. • Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching -- What will your typical day look like? Role Specific Responsibilities • Follow the team’s standards to create and manage an automated DevOps release management pipeline which delivers tooling for next generation application development efforts and on-going production operations. Cultivate a Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery mind set. • Collaborate with engineers and cloud architects to support development teams with a full set of ALM tools by leading the establishment of the right tooling and processes that will result in a fully automated release management pipeline to include: the automated build process, environment setups, testing scripts, deployments, and production operational metrics/debugging information (to target developers). • Partner with development and operations teams to facilitate practical automation solutions and custom modules. Troubleshoot automation issues and when required engage additional resources to find practical solutions that move projects forward. • Be a trusted automation and tooling advisor by providing objective, practical and relevant insights and advice. • Deliver assignments based on project objectives and support projects to completion. Ensure deliverables are completed within target timeframes and are of high-quality. • Support established KPIs to ensure performance is measured against expected business outcomes. About the team Deloitte Technology works at the forefront of technology development and processes to support and protect Deloitte around the world. In this truly global environment, we operate not in "what is" but rather "what can be" to help Deloitte deliver and connect with its clients, its communities, and one another in ways not previously conceived. Enough about us, let’s talk about you • Experience with technical deep dives into infrastructure, databases, and applications in operating, and supporting high-performance, highly available services and infrastructure • Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies across Windows, with hands-on experience on the following domains: • Container technologies, including Kubernetes and Docker • Experience in building, deploying and monitoring Azure services with strong IaaS and PaaS services (Redis Cache, Service Bus, Event Hub, Cloud Service etc.) • Azure Core Platform: Compute, Storage, Networking • Data Platform: SQL, Azure DB, Mongo Atlas • Identity and Authentication: SSO/Federation, AD/Azure AD etc. • Experience with Azure Storage, Backup and Express Route • Experience in managing Windows systems in Azure Public Cloud • Hands-on experience in ARM templates • Knowledge of networking and software defined networking in cloud environments • Ability to write PowerShell scripts to automate IT Operations • VSTS Deployments • Experience developing integration tests, and gate criteria that align with business requirements & project plan using Microsoft standards • Strong experience with instrumentation, monitoring, alerting, and responding relative to performance and availability of application Total Rewards The salary range for this position is $69,000 - $114,000, and individuals may be eligible to participate in our bonus program. Deloitte is fair and competitive when it comes to the salaries of our people. We regularly benchmark across a variety of positions, industries, sectors, targets, and levels. Our approach is grounded on recognizing people's unique strengths and contributions and rewarding the value that they deliver. Our Total Rewards Package extends well beyond traditional compensation and benefit programs and is designed to recognize employee contributions, encourage personal wellness, and support firm growth. Along with a competitive base salary and variable pay opportunities, we offer a wide array of initiatives that differentiate us as a people-first organization. On top of our regular paid vacation days, some examples include: $4,000 per year for mental health support benefits, a $1,300 flexible benefit spending account, firm-wide closures known as "Deloitte Days", dedicated days of for learning (known as Development and Innovation Days), flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work structure. Our promise to our people: Deloitte is where potential comes to life. Be yourself, and more. We are a group of talented people who want to learn, gain experience, and develop skills. Wherever you are in your career, we want you to advance. You shape how we make impact. Diverse perspectives and life experiences make us better. Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we want you to feel like you belong here. We provide flexible working options to support you and how you can contribute. Be the leader you want to be Some guide teams, some change culture, some build essential expertise. We offer opportunities and experiences that support your continuing growth as a leader. Have as many careers as you want. We are uniquely able to offer you new challenges and roles – and prepare you for them. We bring together people with unique experiences and talents, and we are the place to develop a lasting network of friends, peers, and mentors. The next step is yours At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative. We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations) or indigenouscareers@deloitte.ca for any questions relating to careers for Indigenous peoples at Deloitte (First Nations, Inuit, Métis). By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 20 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge that Deloitte offices stand on traditional, treaty, and unceded territories in what is now known as Canada. We recognize that Indigenous Peoples have been the caretakers of this land since time immemorial, nurturing its resources and preserving its natural beauty. We acknowledge this land is still home to many First Nations, Inuit, and Métis Peoples, who continue to maintain their deep connection to the land and its sacred teachings. We humbly acknowledge that we are all Treaty people, and we commit to fostering a relationship of respect, collaboration, and stewardship with Indigenous communities in our shared goal of reconciliation and environmental sustainability.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Hybrid, Equity + Growth

You will ensure reliability and resilience of systems while collaborating with engineers on best practices. Ideal candidates have over 5 years of experience and expertise in AWS, Terraform, Docker, and CI/CD tools, thriving in a dynamic and innovative environment. The role offers competitive compensation, including salary negotiation and annual bonuses, within a hybrid work setting. #J-18808-Ljbffr
